champ.champInfo:
The general management of the organization and conduct of competitions is carried out by the Family, Youth and Sports Department of the Zhytomyr City Council. The Zhytomyr City Kyokushinkai Karate Federation is responsible for the direct holding of the competition.
Chief judge of the competition (head of the organizing committee) - Maksym Valeriyovych Lanovy (Zhytomyr);
Deputy chief judge - Ruslan Serhiyovych Stukal (Zhytomyr)
Secretary of the competition â€“ Oleksandr Valeriyovych Lanovy (Zhytomyr) phone 096-991-23-53

The competition will be held on November 4, 2023 at the address: Zhytomyr, SC "Dynamo", str. Chudnivska 113

Registration of tournament participants takes place through a personal account on the website https://www.alliance-kumite.net

Phone numbers for preliminary applications: Ihor Tatarchenko - +38(067) 788 77 28;

Program

  • 07:00-08:00 arrival of teams, registration
  • 08:00-08:30 approval of competition protocols
  • 08:30-09:00 meeting of competition judges
  • 09:00-09:30 ceremonial opening of the competition
  • 09:30-13:00 qualifying matches
  • 13:00-13:30 lunch
  • 13:30-17:00 semi-final and final matches
  • 17:00-18:00 awarding of winners and prize-winners of the competition, closing of the competition
  • 18:00-18:30 departure of the teams

Competition participants

Athletes, members of national kyokushinkai karate teams of sports organizations (federations, centers, clubs, etc.) who are members of the FKKJHO, as well as invited teams of sports organizations of Ukraine, participate in open competitions. Male and female participants compete in separate sections of the competition.

Tournament rules

  • Protective accessories: groin bandage, helmet for children, pads on shins and hands, chest bandage for girls.
  • If it is determined based on the preliminary applications that there is an insufficient number of participants for a high-quality competition in certain categories, the Organizing Committee may make the following changes to the provisions of these competitions:
    • combine some weight and age categories
    • to hold competitions in specified weight categories in a circular and mixed way

Charity contribution for participation in competitions:

  • Kumite section - 600 UAH.

Categories KUMITE men

  • 2015-2016: -20, -25, -30, -35, -40, +40
  • 2013-2014: -25, -30, -35, -40, -45, -50, +50
  • 2011-2012: -30, -35, -40, -45, -50, -55, +55
  • 2009-2010: -35, -40, -45, -50, -55, -60, +60
  • 2007-2008: -50, -55, -60, -65, -70, -75, +75
  • 2005-2006: -60, -65, -70, -75, -80, +80
  • Men: -65, -75, -85, +85

Categories of KUMITE women

  • 2015-2016: -20, -25, -30, -35, -40, +40
  • 2013-2014: -25, -30, -35, -40, -45, -50, +50
  • 2011-2012: -30, -35, -40, -45, -50, -55, +55
  • 2009-2010: -40, -45, -50, -55, -60, -65, +65
  • 2007-2008: -45, -50, -55, -60, +60
  • 2005-2006: -50, -55, -60, +60
  • Women: -55, -60, -65, +65

The regulation of matches:

  • 2015-2012: 1.0 min, 1.0 min, 1.0 min
  • 2009-2010: 1.5 min, 1.5 min, 1.5 min
  • 2007-2008: 1.5 min, 1.5 min, 1.5 min
  • 2005-2006: 2.0 min, 2.0 min, 2.0 min
  • Men/women qualifying: 2.0 min, 2.0 min, 2.0 min
  • Men/Women semi-final/final: 3.0 min, 2.0 min, 2.0 min

Rewarding

  • Athletes who took 1-3 places are awarded with diplomas, medals of the respective degrees and valuable prizes of the competition organizers
